subject: Politics
title: Disinformation in Elections
description: Learn Disinformation in Elections in one minute.

hook.text: Fake news spreads six times faster than real news on social media. Lies outrun the truth every election.

buildup.text: Disinformation is deliberately false content spread to manipulate voters and undermine trust in elections.

discovery.text: Russia's Internet Research Agency created fake American accounts to inflame divisions during the 2016 election.

twist.text: Domestic disinformation is a bigger threat than foreign. Politicians and media figures spread more lies than bots.

climax.text: Fact-checking helps but can't keep pace. By the time a lie is debunked, millions have already believed it.

punchline.text: Disinformation doesn't need to convince you. It just needs to confuse you.

quiz.question: How fast does fake news spread compared to real news on social media?
